business.headline: Budget 2026: Will new tax slabs ease the burden on middle-income taxpayers?As Budget 2026 approaches, middle-income taxpayers are watching closely for signs of relief. With rising costs and inflation pressures, the big question is whether the government will tweak tax slabs to ease the burden.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as mood turns positive ahead of Budget sessionThe Nifty50 closed 0.66% higher at 25,342.75, while the BSE Sensex gained 0.6% to end at 82,344.68. With this rise, both benchmark indices have added close to 1% over the last two trading sessions.

Is Budget 2026 ready to address startups' compliance, funding and tech gaps?As expectations rise ahead of Budget 2026, startup founders and investors are watching closely to see whether policy announcements will finally ease compliance pressures, unlock domestic capital and strengthen India's technology backbone.

India needs an hourly wage structure before it needs a right to disconnectA right to disconnect sounds progressive, but without a transparent hourly wage structure for white collar professionals, it may end up doing the opposite of what it intends.

8th Pay Commission: A look at real salary hikes so far and what may come nextWith the 8th Pay Commission expected to submit its recommendations in the coming months, attention has turned to the pattern of real salary hikes over the years. A look at earlier pay commissions offers useful clues about what employees may realistically expect this time.

India-EU trade deal: Why textiles could be the biggest quiet winnerThe textile sector gets immediate and meaningful relief under the free trade agreement, with changes that directly improve India's ability to compete in one of the world's largest consumer markets.

Gold is still a safe bet, but why silver is notWith markets on edge, investors are once again turning to precious metals, but not all shine equally. Gold remains a trusted store of value, while silver's recent surge has exposed its higher volatility and cyclical risks.

Gold shoots past Rs 1.62 lakh, silver eyes Rs 4 lakh: Should you buy now?Gold and silver remain firmly in an uptrend, but analysts warn the rally is getting stretched. With prices at record levels, should you buy precious metals or avoid them?
Sensex jumps 600 points: Why is stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex was up 593.83 points to 82,451.31, while the NSE Nifty50 added 189.10 points to 25,364.50 as of 9:25 am.

Live: 95 crore Indians can access social security schemes, says PresidentBudget Session 2026 Live Updates: The Budget Session in the Indian Parliament will begin today. At 11 am, Indian President Draupadi Murmu will address the joint sitting of both houses, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. The opposition parties will hold a meeting around 10 am to chalk out a strategy for the budget session. The opposition parties seek a discussion on issues like the VB-G RAM-G Bill and the implementation of the Special Intensive Revision (SIR). However, the Union Minister for Minority Affairs, Kiren Rijiju, has denied all possibilities of discussions on these issues, as the topics were upheld during the winter session. After today's session, all eyes will be on tomorrow, as the Economic Survey is all set to be unveiled on tomorrow's Parliament session. Catch all the live updates at indiatoday.in.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market rise today? Check hereEarly signals from the Gift Nifty suggest a firm start for the market. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,438.5 at around 8:30 AM. This points to the Nifty 50 opening above Tuesday's closing level of 25,175.4.

India-EU trade deal may not shake auto sector as much as feared. Here's whyA key part of the discussion is around import duties on cars. Under the deal, import duty on fully built imported cars, known as completely built units, could be cut sharply from around 110% to nearly 40% in the initial phase.

Shadowfax IPO listing: Will Shadowfax shares open higher or lower on BSE, NSE?Overall subscription for the Shadowfax Technologies IPO stood at 2.86 times. The retail investor category was subscribed 2.43 times, showing moderate interest from individual investors.

Budget 2026: Why investors want stability, not big surprisesOver the last few years, the government has moved decisively towards a more citizen-friendly direct tax regime, most recently visible in the new tax slabs under the reworked regime for FY 2025–26, where income up to Rs 4 lakh is now tax-free and the higher rate of 30% applies only beyond Rs 24 lakh.

India–EU trade deal a boost for long-term ties amid global uncertainty: EU VP Kaja KallasDescribed as the "mother of all deals", India–EU trade pact is expected to boost trade, lower barriers, and deepen economic ties between the two sides.

New Tax Regime explained: Key changes so far and what Budget 2026 may bringWith the core structure already in place, Budget 2026 is expected to focus on fine-tuning rather than major overhauls. The government is likely to continue strengthening the new regime as a low-tax, low-complexity option suited to a wide range of taxpayers.

Budget 2026: Will simpler rules and digital support boost India's e-commerce sector?With India's e-commerce ecosystem expanding rapidly, expectations from Budget 2026 are centred on regulatory simplicity and digital infrastructure to support millions of online sellers and platforms.

India-EU FTA explained: What the 'mother of all trade deals' means for youIndia and EU have finalised the mother of all deals, laying the groundwork for cheaper goods, stronger jobs and a deeper Indian presence in global markets. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex ends 320 points higher; Nifty above 25,100; Axis Bank up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 319.78 points to 81,857.48, while the NSE Nifty50 added 127.50 points to 25,175.40 as of 3:51 PM.
Video: EU's Antonio Costa whips out Indian OCI card to PM Modi's laughterWhile talking about the historic Indo-EU trade deal, Antonio Costa speaks about his roots in Goa.

entertainment.headline: Samantha–Raj Nidimoru's cute pickleball moment wins internet. Watch A video featuring Samantha Ruth Prabhu and filmmaker Raj Nidimoru laughing together during a pickleball match has gone viral on social media. The two got married in December 2025.

How Rajinikanth's encouragement nudged Abishan Jeevinth into acting Abishan Jeevinth, known for his directorial debut Tourist Family, steps into acting with the romantic comedy With Love. Ahead of its release the actor-director shared the kind of encouragement he got from superstar Rajinikanth.

Emraan Hashmi recalls the day his son was diagnosed with cancer: My world flipped Emraan Hashmi opened up about the painful period when his son was diagnosed with cancer in 2014, calling it the toughest phase of his life.

Karthi's Vaa Vaathiyaar streams on Prime Video after two-week theatrical run Karthi's film Vaa Vaathiyaar, directed by Nalan Kumarasamy, is now available on Amazon Prime Video in multiple languages after a brief two-week run in theatres following its Pongal release.

Varun Dhawan re-shares Shashank Khaitan post about his tedhi smile, cleanest heart Varun Dhawan is winning praise for his performance in Border 2 after facing trolling over his "tedhi smile." Filmmaker Shashank Khaitan backed the actor, calling his performance sincere as the film continues to do well at the box office.

Wheel of Fortune India 1st impression: Akshay Kumar spins fun into classic game 'Wheel of Fortune India' may be a familiar game, but Akshay Kumar's charm gives it a fresh spin. Laughter, puzzles, and a dash of Bollywood star power make it a ride worth taking with the whole family.

Diljit Dosanjh recalls watching Border on TV as he couldn't buy theatre tickets Diljit Dosanjh recalled an emotional memory as a kid when he could not afford to buy the tickets for Sunny Deol's Border in theatre. The actor features alongside Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty and others in Border 2.

Anupam Kher calls Rohit Sharma cool dude after accidental meeting in vanity van Anupam Kher shared details of an accidental meeting with Rohit Sharma after mistakenly entering the cricketer's vanity van. He called the Indian cricketer the "greatest cool dude."
Mammootty honoured on Padayaatra sets following Padma Bhushan recognition The team of Adoor Gopalakrishnan's Padayaatra honoured Mammootty on set after the veteran actor received the Padma Bhushan.

Akshay Kumar, Sanjay Dutt to Kangana Ranaut, celebs mourn Ajit Pawar's death Bollywood celebrities including Akshay Kumar, Sanjay Dutt, Vivek Oberoi, and Kangana Ranaut shared their condolences after Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's fatal plane crash while en route to Baramati.

Shreya Ghoshal backs Arijit Singh after playback retirement: Not the end of an era Shreya Ghoshal responded positively to Arijit Singh's announcement that he will retire from playback singing, encouraging him as he embarks on a new phase in his music career.

Vishnuvardhan, Ambareesh, Puneeth in 18-minute song of Upendra's Raktha Kashmira? Upendra-starrer Raktha Kashmira, which was reportedly shot nearly 14 years ago, is finally heading to theatres in Karnataka this week.

Orry calls Ibrahim 'most besharam', recalls how friendship with Sara Ali Khan began Social media influencer Orry criticised actor Ibrahim Ali Khan in a recent podcast. He called him "the most besharam in the industry" and discussed how his friendship with Sara Ali Khan began.

Hrithik Roshan reviews Sunny Deol's latest war drama hit Border 2 Hrithik Roshan took to social media to celebrate the success of Border 2, calling the film "all heart." He congratulated the entire team as the war epic continues to dominate the box office following its massive Republic Day weekend.

ENHYPEN star and former figure skater Sunghoon to carry Olympic torch Sunghoon of ENHYPEN has been named a torchbearer for the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics. This role highlights his unique journey from athlete to K-pop star and reflects the growing global influence of K-pop.

Sarvam Maya on OTT: When and where to watch Nivin Pauly's first Rs 100-crore hit Nivin Pauly's horror-comedy Sarvam Maya, which became his first film to cross the Rs 100 crore mark worldwide, is set for its digital premiere on JioHotstar after a successful theatrical run.

Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan reunite with Border 2 team for success bash. Pics The entire team of 'Border 2', including Sunny Deol and Varun Dhawan, gathered to commemorate the film's impressive commercial performance and critical acclaim.
Riteish Deshmukh mourns Ajit Pawar's death; recalls dynamic leadership, kindness Actor Riteish Deshmukh expressed deep sorrow over the death of  Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar.

Sita Ramam 2? Mrunal Thakur and Dulquer Salmaan's new viral pic sparks buzz A recent image featuring Mrunal Thakur and Dulquer Salmaan has led to widespread speculation among fans about a possible sequel to Sita Ramam, though no official confirmation has been made.

general news.headline: Will Ajit's wife Sunetra emerge as the new Pawar centre of NCP?Ajit Pawar's death in an air crash on Wednesday has thrown the NCP into uncertainty. Attention, naturally, has shifted to Sunetra Pawar. Long seen away from frontline politics, the Rajya Sabha MP might now be at the centre of the Ajit Pawar faction. She is well-connected, has experience, and public sympathy.

Ajit Pawar, 4 others killed in plane crash in Baramati: What we know so farMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died in a plane crash on Wednesday morning. He was heading to Baramati to address four public meetings ahead of the Zilla Parishad elections when the crash took place.

Amazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally to undo pandemic-era hiring amid AI push, second round of layoffs in 3 monthsAmazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally to undo pandemic-era hiring amid AI push, second round of layoffs in 3 months

Ajit Pawar's political family tree: Roots, branches, and legacyAjit Pawar belonged to one of Maharashtra's most influential political families, with deep roots in Baramati and state politics. His family includes several leaders across generations, with ties to Sharad Pawar's political dynasty.

Shreya Ghoshal backs Arijit Singh after playback retirement: Not the end of an eraShreya Ghoshal responded positively to Arijit Singh's announcement that he will retire from playback singing, encouraging him as he embarks on a new phase in his music career.

Day 11 Live Updates: Sinner sets up Djokovic semi-final clashAustralian Open, Day 11 Live Updates: Jannik Sinner cruised past Ben Shelton to secure his spot in the semi-finals of the Australian Open. This is his third consecutive appearance in the final four in Melbourne and will go up against Novak Djokovic.

Ajit Pawar contributed a lot to Maharashtra, standing firm with his family: PMAjit Pawar and five other people died after their chartered aircraft crashed while trying to land in the Baramati region of Pune district on Wednesday morning.

First call at 8:13 am, go around and then flames: Details of Ajit Pawar jet crashThe aircraft carrying Ajit Pawar that crashed on Wednesday was cleared to land on runway 11, but there was no readback and a minute later, the ATC saw flames.

Amrita Singh traumatised me: Orry opens up on fallout with Sara Ali KhanSocial media influencer Orry opened up about his fallout with Sara Ali Khan and her family, saying the feud can only end if Amrita Singh apologises. He also addresses unfollows, online jabs, and remarks about Sara's acting career.

Are small planes more prone to accidents? If so, why?Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar was killed in a crash involving a small charter jet, the Bombardier Learjet 45. This has put the spotlight on the safety of small aircraft. While they are not inherently unsafe, smaller planes are more prone to accidents, show data. This is what makes smaller aircraft prone to crashes compared to the bigger ones.

How Ajit Pawar's death leaves Maha politics facing biggest questions in yearsAjit Pawar's sudden death has left a void in Maharashtra politics. A mass leader, power broker and strategist, his absence might unsettle the ruling Mahayuti and throw the future of a divided NCP into doubt. It raises questions over leadership and succession in the NCP camp.

Ajit Pawar's aircraft crashed due to fog; body identified by watch and clothesSources have indicated that visibility had dropped sharply in the morning and the aircraft was on approach when it went down. Rescue teams reached the site but found the jet destroyed by the impact and fire.

Heavy snowfall triggers dramatic 'river of snow' in Himachal villageA rare 'river of snow' was witnessed flowing through Pangi valley in Himachal Pradesh amid heavy snowfall, and videos of the phenomenon have been going viral on social media.
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

New Aadhaar app is here: Top features, where to get it, and moreThe Government of India has rolled out a new Aadhaar app that brings offline verification, selective data sharing, and easier access to Aadhaar services, aiming to make everyday identity checks simpler and more secure for users.

India-EU trade deal: Why textiles could be the biggest quiet winnerThe textile sector gets immediate and meaningful relief under the free trade agreement, with changes that directly improve India's ability to compete in one of the world's largest consumer markets.

Final moments of Ajit Pawar's doomed plane reconstructed using flight dataIndia Today analysed flight data and pinpointed the crash site using available footage to show what happened in the final moments before the crash.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

When we travel by plane...: Ajit Pawar's 2024 tweet resurfaces after Baramati crashAn old tweet by Ajit Pawar about travelling by plane has resurfaced after his untimely death in a plane crash on Wednesday.

Video: When Ajit Pawar's oath remark drew Shinde's quip and Fadnavis's laughterAhead of the oath-taking ceremony, Fadnavis, Shinde and Pawar held a joint press conference on the historic mandate to the BJP-Sena-NCP alliance in Maharashtra elections. During the press conference, Shinde and Pawar had a light-hearted banter which left the room in splits.

Air India Express pilot retires, daughter narrates video of his final flightAir India Express pilot Om takes his final flight as his daughter narrates a wholesome farewell video, marking the end of his distinguished aviation career.

Ajit Pawar death: Mamata Banerjee hints at foul play, wants court-monitored probeMamata Banerjee has demanded a Supreme Court-monitored investigation into the fatal plane crash that killed Ajit Pawar, raising concerns over the safety of political leaders and calling for a credible probe under the Supreme Court's supervision.

Who were Captains Sumit Kapoor, Shambhavi Pathak who died in Ajit Pawar jet crash?A tragic air crash near Baramati Airport claimed the life of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and five others during a routine political trip. The incident has left the state in mourning and prompted a thorough investigation.

Wheel of Fortune India 1st impression: Akshay Kumar spins fun into classic game'Wheel of Fortune India' may be a familiar game, but Akshay Kumar's charm gives it a fresh spin. Laughter, puzzles, and a dash of Bollywood star power make it a ride worth taking with the whole family.

sports.headline: Djokovic backs Gauff after broadcaster row: Surprised we have no cameras in shower Novak Djokovic backs Coco Gauff after her Australian Open outburst, criticising excessive camera culture and warning about players' lack of privacy. Gauff's outburst video went viral after loss in the quarterfinal.

Jannik Sinner hammers Ben Shelton to set up blockbuster Novak Djokovic semifinal Australian Open: Jannik Sinner beat Ben Shelton 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 in the quarterfinals and advanced to the semis, where he will lock horns with Novak Djokovic, who has 10 titles to his name at Melbourne Park.

4th T20I Live: All eyes on Sanju Samson as India look to extend lead in Vizag India (IND) vs New Zealand (NZ) Live Score: All eyes will be on Sanju Samson when India take on New Zealand in the 4th T20I of the series. India have already taken an unassailable 3-0 lead in the series and will look to do their experiments in the final two matches.

Joe Root defends Brook's beer smash celebration: No malice, just a joke with us Joe Root has jumped to the defence of Harry Brook's beer-smash celebration during the 3rd ODI against Sri Lanka, saying that it was just light-hearted banter with his teammates. Brook celebrated in Stone Cold Steve Austin style after scoring his hundred against Sri Lanka.

Suryakumar Yadav earns big ranking boost in ideal build-up to T20 World Cup Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav has climbed back into the top 10 of the ICC rankings following his impressive showing in the first three T20Is of the five-match series against New Zealand.

Arijit Singh's best moment on cricket field. Ft. Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni Arijit Singh's announcement of his retirement from film playback singing sparked an emotional response from fans, with old posts from Virat Kohli praising the singer's talent resurfacing online.

The return of Ravi Bishnoi: How tweaked action helped spinner return to his best Former World No.1 T20I bowler Ravi Bishnoi fell off the radar last season. Given a chance in the New Zealand T20Is, just before the World Cup, Bishnoi made an epic return with a spell of 4-0-18-2 in the 3rd T20I.

Iceland troll Pakistan for T20 World Cup theatrics: Your replacement is ready Iceland Cricket trolled Pakistan amid speculation over a possible T20 World Cup boycott. The post comes as the ICC warns of heavy sanctions if Pakistan attempt a last-minute withdrawal like Bangladesh.

Ajit Pawar plane crash: Sachin Tendulkar mourns Maharashtra Deputy CM's death Sachin Tendulkar has mourned the death of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar after a tragic plane crash. The cricket legend called Pawar a dedicated leader and offered condolences to his family.

Novak Djokovic survives major scare against Lorenzo Musetti Australian Open: 10-time champion Novak Djokovic survived a major scare against Italy's Lorenzo Musetti on Wednesday, January 28. Ahead by 2 sets, Musseti pulled out of the competition due to a thigh injury.

Tottenham Hotspur and France forward Randal Kolo Muani involved in car crash Tottenham forward Randal Kolo Muani was involved in a minor car accident while travelling for Champions League duty. Manager Thomas Frank confirmed the French striker is fine and expected to be available.

India favourites in T20 World Cup, but Dravid warns against one bad day in officeFormer India head coach Rahul Dravid believes that India start as the favourites in the T20 World Cup. However, Dravid has warned that one bad day can undo years of good work.

Are we tennis players or animals in a zoo? Swiatek lashes out at AUS Open broadcastersIga Swiatek has questioned the intense behind-the-scenes coverage at the Australian Open after her quarter-final exit. The world No. 2 backed Coco Gauff's call for more privacy away from the court.

Abhishek Sharma better than Chris Gayle? Former India star's big praise for openerMohammed Kaif has compared Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting to Chris Gayle after his New Zealand onslaught. The former India batter said Abhishek's consistency and instant impact set him apart from most power-hitters.

Time to stop tinkering? Should India play their T20 World Cup XI vs New ZealandIndia have been ringing in the changes in every single game of the New Zealand series so far. While testing the bench strength is needed, the Indian team should be playing their best side at all times just before the T20 World Cup 2026.

4th T20I preview: Sanju Samson seeks a spark as Vizag braces for a stormIndia vs New Zealand, 4th T20I preview: India's marauding T20 machine descends on Vizag for the fourth instalment of what has been a one-sided series so far. Sanju Samson will be in focus as the star opener hopes to find form after an extended training session on Tuesday.

Abhishek Sharma posts new photo, Yuvraj Singh steals show with hilarious tauntYuvraj Singh poked fun at in-form India opener Abhishek Sharma after his latest social media post. The mentor's cheeky comment came as Abhishek continues his blazing run in T20Is.

Brook, Root hundreds help England put behind Ashes horror, seal series vs SLHarry Brook and Joe Root's hundreds were enough for England to put behind their Ashes disappointment and get winning momentum on their side as they sealed the ODI series against Sri Lanka.

Day 11 Live Updates: Sinner sets up Djokovic semi-final clashAustralian Open, Day 11 Live Updates: Jannik Sinner cruised past Ben Shelton to secure his spot in the semi-finals of the Australian Open. This is his third consecutive appearance in the final four in Melbourne and will go up against Novak Djokovic.

Jemimah urges quick regroup as Delhi Capitals' playoff hopes hang by a threadWPL 2026, DC vs GG: Jemimah Rodrigues said that Delhi Capitals (DC) need to recover from their defeat against Gujarat Giants and regroup before their must-win clash against the UP Warriorz.

Sophie Devine haunts Delhi Capitals again as Gujarat Giants survive late thrillerWPL 2026, DC vs GG: Sophie Devine defended nine runs in the last over as the Gujarat Giants beat the Jemimah Rodrigues-led Delhi Capitals on Tuesday to stay alive in the race for the playoffs.

Vijay Amritraj on receiving Padma Bhushan: My wife and I were in tearsVijay Amritraj recalls the emotional moment he learnt about his Padma Bhushan honour, becoming the only sportsperson to receive the award this year. Amritraj was honoured for his contributions to tennis during his storied career.

IND vs NZ, 4th T20I: Axar set for return, but who will make way in Vizag?India vs New Zealand 4th T20I predicted XIs: India are all set to back Sanju Samson at the top and Axar Patel is all set to make his return to the side after recovering from his injury early on in the series.

Give your life: Vijay Amritraj on the toughest challenge in individual sports in IndiaIn the special segment, India Today's Rajdeep Sardesai speaks with tennis legend Vijay Amritraj following the announcement of his Padma Bhushan award in the sports category. Amritraj emphasized that for young athletes to succeed in individual sports in India, dedication to their chosen sport from an early age is essential.

Sanju Samson finds his flow in Vizag nets, Shreyas Iyer enjoys a marathonIndia vs New Zealand, 4th T20I: Sanju Samson and Shreyas Iyer had extended batting sessions in Visakhapatnam during India's optional training on Tuesday. Axar Patel, returning from injury, eased into rhythm as India showed no signs of loosening their grip on the series against a New Zealand side struggling for answers.

U19 World Cup: Vihaan Malhotra's 109 powers India to 204-run win over ZimbabweVihaan Malhotra's century powered India to a dominant 204-run win over Zimbabwe in their first Super Six match of the ICC Under-19 World Cup 2026 at the Queen's Sports Club in Bulawayo on Tuesday.

SA20 wants to have coach Sourav Ganguly back despite final heartbreak: Graeme SmithDespite suffering another final heartbreak in South Africa, Graeme Smith wants to see Sourav Ganguly make a return to the SA20 as a coach. Ganguly helped Pretoria Capitals reach the final of the SA20 2026 season.

Rohit Sharma led India's white-ball evolution from the front: Rahul DravidRahul Dravid reflected on India's rise in white-ball cricket and the evolution of leadership within the team, while crediting Rohit Sharma for spearheading the change.

Aryna Sabalenka wins hearts with cheeky birthday request to Carlos AlcarazAryna Sabalenka sparked a fun moment at the 2026 Australian Open after her quarter-final win, joking that she would gift Carlos Alcaraz a TikTok dance in a nod to their shared birthday and past viral clip.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
